papers.title: Masking AES with d+1 Shares in Hardware
papers.authors: Thomas De Cnudde, Oscar Reparaz, Begül Bilgin, Svetla Nikova, Ventzislav Nikov, Vincent Rijmen
papers.abstract: Masking requires splitting sensitive variables into at least d+1 shares to provide security against DPA attacks at order d. To this date, this minimal number has only been deployed in software implementations of cryptographic algorithms and in the linear parts of their hardware counterparts. So far there is no hardware construction that achieves this lower bound if the function is nonlinear and the underlying logic gates can glitch. In this paper, we give practical implementations of the AES using d+1 shares aiming at first- and second-order security even in the presence of glitches. To achieve this, we follow the conditions presented by Reparaz et al. at CRYPTO 2015 to allow hardware masking schemes, like Threshold Implementations, to provide theoretical higher-order security with d+1 shares. The decrease in number of shares has a direct impact in the area requirements: our second-order DPA resistant core is the smallest in area so far, and its S-box is 50% smaller than the current smallest Threshold Implementation of the AES S-box with similar security and attacker model. We assess the security of our masked cores by practical side-channel evaluations. The security guarantees are met with 100 million traces.
papers.abstract_zh: 屏蔽要求将敏感变量分成至少d+1份，以提供抵御d阶DPA攻击的安全性。迄今为止，这一最小数量仅部署在加密算法的软件实现及其硬件对应物的线性部分中。到目前为止，如果函数是非线性的，并且底层逻辑门可能出现毛刺，则没有硬件结构可以达到这个下限。在本文中，我们给出了使用d+1份额的AES的实际实现，旨在一阶和二阶安全性，即使在存在毛刺的情况下。为了实现这一点，我们遵循Reparaz等人在CRYPTO 2015上提出的条件，以允许硬件屏蔽方案(如阈值实现)提供理论上具有d+1份额的高阶安全性。份额数量的减少对面积要求有直接影响:我们的二阶抗DPA内核是迄今为止面积最小的内核，其S盒比具有类似安全性和攻击者模型的AES S盒的当前最小阈值实现小50%。我们通过实际的侧信道评估来评估屏蔽内核的安全性。安全保障满足1亿条痕迹。
papers.title_zh: 在硬件中屏蔽具有d+1份额的AES
